RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 1 1M Dirt CR: 80. Claiming Purse 13000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE JUNE 6. Three Year Olds, 125 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 6 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000 (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weig ht Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SUDDEN SHIFT hopped at the start, was the distant trailer down the backside, rallied into the turn to close ground on the field and closed with a rush down the lane to be up in time. RRACE DAY WARRIOR pressed the pace from the fence to the turn, battled from the inside in a three horse duel to the quarter pole, shook clear in mid-stretch and was caught in the shadow of the wire in a game effort. HADDASSAH'S DEVIL stalked the leaders into the far turn, circled four wide to loom turning for home and kept-on through the lane while failing to gain ground. MAXIMIZER tracked the pace down the backstretch, made a three wide bid in the turn to take a brief lead and weakened in the stretch. DEBDURITE set a pressured pace from two wide between horses to the three-eighths pole and faded coming home. SAY HEY KID was never a threat. POWER (BRZ) was not a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Sudden Shift
ENTRY.COMMENT: hop start, distant trailer, closed w/rush, in time

ENTRY.NAME: Say Hey Kid
ENTRY.COMMENT: failed to menace, no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Power (BRZ)
ENTRY.COMMENT: no factor, outrun

ENTRY.NAME: Rrace Day Warrior
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, took command, shook clear, caught late

ENTRY.NAME: Debdurite
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Haddassah's Devil
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, circled 4w, loomed, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Maximizer
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked, bid 3w, brief lead, weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 2 6F Dirt CR: 86. Claiming Purse 13000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE JUNE 6. Three Year Olds, 125 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 6 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000 (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weig ht Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MY TWO AUNT JOANS tracked the leaders into the turn, rallied four wide through the turn, engaged the leaders from the seven path in mid-stretch, drifted in through the lane causing CRYO to clip heels in deep stretch and pulled clear to the wire. MONTAUK COVE set the pace from the fence to midway on the bend, was over-taken in a three way duel on the turn and kept-on willingly along the fence through the stretch. THE COOKIE MAN pressed the pace to the turn, took command from three wide nearing the quarter pole, bumped with CRYO in upper stretch and weakened in the stretch drive. UNCLEJACKOMO went evenly while never posing a threat. TWO GUNS raced at the rear of the field into the turn, steadied along the fence when commencing rally at the three-eighths pole, dropped out of contention and lost rider when jumped the fallen rider off CRYO in the stretch while finishing evenly. CRYO dueled between rivals on the lead through the turn, bumped rival upper stretch, took the lead, passed by closing winner who drifted in causing him to clip heels and unseat his rider in the lane. THE STEWARDS POSTED AN INQUIRY INTO THE STRETCH RUN AND UPON REVIEW DISQUALIFIED THE WINNER AND PLACED HIM FOURTH.

ENTRY.NAME: Two Guns
ENTRY.COMMENT: steadied turn, jumped fallen rider, lost rider, walked off

ENTRY.NAME: Montauk Cove
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, rail trip, kept on

ENTRY.NAME: Cryo
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled between, bumped upper, clip heels, lost rider, walked off

ENTRY.NAME: Unclejackomo
ENTRY.COMMENT: one-paced, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: dq-My Two Aunt Joans
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked, rally 7path, drifted in, impeded rival, pulled clear

ENTRY.NAME: The Cookie Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, bid 3w, brief lead, bumped upper, weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 3 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 91. Claiming Purse 17600. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 125 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 6 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000 (Races Where Entered For $7,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances) (Ohio Registered Foals Pref erred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SHELL FIRE slow early to trail the field, raced wide in the clear down the backstretch, rallied steadily from five wide midway on the turn, angled to the eight path at the head of the lane, and found his best stride late to be up in time at the wire. SMASH set the pace on a clear lead to midway down the lane and was caught in the final yards by the fast closing winner. FRANCO reserved off the pace through the turn, saved ground rallying along the fence in the stretch and was gaining late. BOURBON OVER ICE raced wide in the first turn, settled to stalk the pacesetter to upper stretch and kept on through the lane willingly. TUSKEGEE CAT tracked the pace from three wide under stout restraint down the backside while in striking position, bumped rival turning for home and failed to gain in the stretch drive. SKIDSTREAM well placed along the rail just off the leader to the far turn, made a bid up the inside to the quarter pole and finished evenly. DON'T POKE THE CAT well placed through the turn, rallied turning for home, exchanged bumps in upper stretch and flattened out. SCAT SHACK failed to menace. TAMANRASSETT was never a threat.

ENTRY.NAME: Skidstream
ENTRY.OWNER: Lion Palm Racing Stable and Sixth Gear LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed, bid inside, even late

ENTRY.NAME: Franco
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved, rail rally, gaining late

ENTRY.NAME: Scat Shack
ENTRY.COMMENT: never menaced

ENTRY.NAME: Smash
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, clear lead, caught

ENTRY.NAME: Tamanrassett
ENTRY.COMMENT: no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Don't Poke the Cat
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed, bumped stretch, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: Bourbon Over Ice
ENTRY.COMMENT: wide 1st turn, stalked pace, kept on

ENTRY.NAME: Shell Fire
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, raced wide, angled 8path, best stride late, in time

ENTRY.NAME: Tuskegee Cat
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3 wide, well held, failed to gain

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 97. Claiming Purse 22000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 125 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 6 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000 (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BACKATYA set the pace while under pressure, briefly surrendered the lead turning for home, repelled the challenger in upper stretch, shook clear in mid-stretch and held the closer safe at the wire in a game effort. STATESBORO slow early to trail well off the rear of the body of the field, made a steady advance turning for home and finished well with a belated rally. DOCTOR WU pressed the pace from three wide, briefly took the lead while rallying at the top of the stretch and finished willingly while not quite well enough. OVER THE HILLS raced prominently throughout, drifted wide down the lane while mounting a rally and finished evenly in deep stretch. FREEDOM RIDER flashed early speed to be on the pace, settled off the leaders down the backside and failed to gain ground in the stretch drive. SUMMERFEST rallied in the turn from four wide and flattened out in upper stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Freedom Rider
ENTRY.COMMENT: early speed, settled, failed to gain

ENTRY.NAME: Over the Hills
ENTRY.COMMENT: prominent, drifted wide stretch, even late

ENTRY.NAME: Backatya
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, responded, shook clear, held sway

ENTRY.NAME: Statesboro
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, steady advance, belatedly

ENTRY.NAME: Summerfest
ENTRY.COMMENT: brief 4 wide, bid, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: Doctor Wu
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, brief lead, willingly, not enough

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 57. Claiming Purse 19400. FOR REGISTERED OHIO BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 125 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 6 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DANCE DRAMA prompted the pace into the turn, rallied three wide to assume command turning for home and drew off in the lane. PENNY'S TREASURE reserved off the pace along the fence through the turn, angled three wide in upper stretch and finished willingly to be up for the place. HALO EFFECT broke outward to bump rivals away from the gate, tracked the leaders from wide to the top of the lane, angled five wide and made steady progress through the lane. DEE'S KY WILDCAT slow early to trail, worked his way to the outside in upper stretch and rallied belatedly. TOTAL SMOKESHOW was knocked sideways leaving the gate when inside rival broke outward, raced mid-pack throughout and showed some late interest. TITEBLUEJEANS unhurried for the first half and rallied mildly in the lane. RUBY LAYNE set the pace from the rail to the quarter pole and weakened in the stretch. BONNIE'S BEST bumped at the start, raced near the rear of the field and failed to menace. SWEET AS MERRIE pressed the pace from between rivals for a half mile and gave way. MACHEN REIGNS was never a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Dee's Ky Wildcat
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, angled clear, belatedly

ENTRY.NAME: Machen Reigns
ENTRY.COMMENT: no threat, no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Penny's Treasure
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved inside, angled 3 wide, willingly

ENTRY.NAME: Titebluejeans
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, mild bid

ENTRY.NAME: Ruby Layne
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace ins, steadily weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Dance Drama
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompt pace, bid 3w, assumed command, drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Sweet as Merrie
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, between rivals, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Halo Effect
ENTRY.OWNER: Yoder Susan D and Yoder Lori D
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke outward, bump rivals, tracked wide, steady gain

ENTRY.NAME: Bonnie's Best
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, never menaced

ENTRY.NAME: Total Smokeshow
ENTRY.COMMENT: knocked sideways break, rallied, even late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 17600. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 125 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 6 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000 (Races Where Entered For $7,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: EPICUREAN broke alertly to take command from the gate, set a well rated early pace, opened a clear advantage on the bend and widened at will through the lane as much best. BACKSPLASH rallied between rivals entering the turn and finished willingly as second best while unable to threaten the winner. JOYFUL NOISE raced four wide into the turn while commencing a rally in a long drive and finished evenly in the lane. SPLASH OF TONIC rallied from the rail in the turn, tipped around the stopping rival on the bend and was unable to sustain his bid in the stretch. HIGH SPEED showed brief speed to press the pace for a half mile and was through early.

ENTRY.NAME: High Speed
ENTRY.COMMENT: brief speed, pressed pace, through early

ENTRY.NAME: Splash of Tonic
ENTRY.COMMENT: rally turn, failed to sustain bid

ENTRY.NAME: Backsplash
ENTRY.COMMENT: rally between, no match, willingly, second best

ENTRY.NAME: Epicurean
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke alertly, well rated, clear turn, widened, much best

ENTRY.NAME: Joyful Noise
ENTRY.OWNER: Nana's Nest and Cline Robert C
ENTRY.COMMENT: bid 4 wide, long drive, finished evenly

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 7 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 85. Claiming Purse 17700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE AUGUST 6. Three Year Olds, 125 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 6 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BAREBACK FUN broke alertly to take the lead from the gate, set a pressured pace to the quarter pole, responded when called upon and drew off through the lane. JEN'S BATTLE slow early to trail the field, angled six wide at the top of the lane and closed well finding her best stride late to be up for the place. TIZ INDEPENDENCE unhurried in the early going, rallied from four wide in the stretch while splitting rivals with a late gain. CEVICHE well placed while saving ground along the fence and failed to gain ground in the stretch. SWEET QUEEN BEE hustled early to press the pace and flattened out turning for home. FLATTERY'S MUSIC stalked the pacesetters while racing three wide through the turn and weakened in the lane. HERO'S DAUGHTER was never a threat. BLAZING ZENNA contended for the first half and dropped back as a non-factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Bareback Fun
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke alertly, set pressured pace, drew away, no doubt

ENTRY.NAME: Blazing Zenna
ENTRY.COMMENT: dropped back, no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Ceviche
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed, saved ground, no gain

ENTRY.NAME: Tiz Independence
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, split rivals stretch, late gain

ENTRY.NAME: Sweet Queen Bee
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled, pressed pace, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: Jen's Battle
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, angled wide, best stride late, up for place

ENTRY.NAME: Flattery's Music
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, 3 wide, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Hero's Daughter
ENTRY.COMMENT: no threat,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 8 1M Dirt CR: 85. Claiming Purse 14900. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 125 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 6 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500 (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: EXONERATED PREZ stalked the pace from the fence down the backside, tipped out two wide in the far turn to engage the leader, took command in mid-stretch while drifting out and finished determinedly to hold the closers safe. ALEXIS N NIKO was caught wide on the first turn, settled off the pace down the backside, commenced a five wide rally in the final bend and closed well down the stretch while widest of all. MAYITO moved up late on the first turn to be wide, tracked the leaders down the backside, made a four wide bid in the turn to be prominent in upper stretch, had to angle inside the drifting leader through the lane and kept coming late. STRASBOURG tracked the leaders from the fence, saved ground cutting the corner turning for home and finished willingly. MASTER opened a clear lead down the backside, maintained that lead through the turn, responded well when challenged in upper stretch and kept on down the lane in a good try. FISHING FOR FUN chased the pacesetter for a half mile from three wide and gradually faded. LONG RAP SHEET was well placed and went evenly lacking a response. KING SOCIAL trailed most of the way and passed tiring rivals in the stretch. RUBINSTEIN was never a threat. LUCKY SMILE steadied briefly turning on to the backstretch and dropped out as a non-factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Exonerated Prez
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace inside, bid 2w, drifted out stretch, determined

ENTRY.NAME: Lucky Smile
ENTRY.COMMENT: steadied backside, no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Long Rap Sheet
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed, evenly

ENTRY.NAME: Strasbourg
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside, saved ground, willingly

ENTRY.NAME: Rubinstein
ENTRY.OWNER: R and P Racing Stables, LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Master
ENTRY.COMMENT: clear lead, responded, kept-on

ENTRY.NAME: King Social
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, trailed, passed tiring rivals,

ENTRY.NAME: Fishing for Fun
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Alexis N Niko
ENTRY.COMMENT: wide turns, closed well, gaining

ENTRY.NAME: Mayito
ENTRY.COMMENT: wide trip, loomed upper, through traffic lane
